bibl.title: Howard McMillen v. O. D. Butterfield. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Territory of Washington, County of Kinm, ss
I, H. F. Jones being first duly sworn on my oath depose and say: That I am over the age of 21 years, that I am a resident of the Territory of Washington, that I am an attorney and counsellor at law, du,y authorized to practice in the courts of the said Territroy.

That I have talked with and consulted J. H. Woolery a deputy sheriff of said county, that from said conservation and consultation I verily beleive and do beleive and have been informed that the said J. H. Woolery will swear that he the said Woolery is the person who, acting as deputy sheriff served the writ of Habeas Corpus in the cause wherein one Howard McMillen is the petitioner, upon ong, bring the same Buterfeild making the of said Petition O. D. Buterfield, that the s.id deputy sheriff will swear that the said writ was served upon the said Buterfield before the United States Marshall had the said Howard McMillen the petitioner inor the said writ in his possession. THe affiant futher says: That he has for more than three hours prior to the filing of this affidavit been trying to and has made diligent search to find the said J. H. Woolery, that the said Woolery is as this affiant beleives engaged in his official dutiis of such deputy sheriff., and has not attempted to secrete himself from ttis affiant. H F Jones Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th, day of May 1889 H. F. Jones Notary Public, in and for Washington Territory.
